PageTitle: peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib (BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view)(IPv4)
FuncDef:
The peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib command sets the maximum duration for a BGP restarter to wait for the End-of-RIB flag from a specified peer.
The undo peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib command deletes the configured duration. The peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib command sets the maximum duration for a BGP restarter to wait for the End-of-RIB flag from a specified peer. The undo peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib command deletes the configured duration. By default, a BGP restarter waits for the End-of-RIB flag from a specified peer for a maximum of 600s.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 peer address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the maximum duration for a BGP restarter to wait for the End-of-RIB flag.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 3000, in seconds.

ExtraInfo: After the local device reestablishes a BGP session with a specified peer, the local device should receive the End-Of-RIB flag from the specified peer within the period specified by this command. If the local device does not receive the End-Of-RIB flag within the period specified by this command, the local device exits the GR process and selects the optimal route from the existing routes.
